verses.verse: Song of Praise and Prayer for Jerusalem A Song of Ascents. Of David. (Isa 2.3; Zech 8.21) I was glad when they said to me, “Let us go to the house of the LORD!”
Our feet are standing within your gates, O Jerusalem.
(Ps 48.13) Jerusalem—built as a city that is bound firmly together.
(Ex 16.34; Deut 16.16) To it the tribes go up, the tribes of the LORD, as was decreed for Israel, to give thanks to the name of the LORD.
(Deut 17.8; 2 Chr 19.8) For there the thrones for judgment were set up, the thrones of the house of David.
(Ps 51.18) Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: “May they prosper who love you.
Peace be within your walls and security within your towers.”
For the sake of my relatives and friends I will say, “Peace be within you.”
(Neh 2.10) For the sake of the house of the LORD our God, I will seek your good.
